012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
013
014import java.sql.ResultSet;
015import java.sql.ResultSetMetaData;
016import java.sql.SQLException;
017
018import static java.util.Arrays.fill;
019
020import org.postgresql.pljava.ResultSetProvider;
021import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
022import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
023import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLActions;
024import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLType;
025
026/**
027 * Example demonstrating the use of a {@code RECORD} parameter as a way to
028 * supply an arbitrary sequence of named, typed parameters to a PL/Java
029 * function.
030 *<p>
031 * Also tests the proper DDR generation of defaults for such parameters.
032 *<p>
033 * This example relies on {@code implementor} tags reflecting the PostgreSQL
034 * version, set up in the {@link ConditionalDDR} example.
035 */
036@SQLActions({
037    @SQLAction(
038        provides = "paramtypeinfo type", // created in Triggers.java
039        install = {
040            "CREATE TYPE javatest.paramtypeinfo AS (" +
041            " name text, pgtypename text, javaclass text, tostring text" +
042            ")"
043        },
044        remove = {
045            "DROP TYPE javatest.paramtypeinfo"
046        }
047    )
048})
049public class RecordParameterDefaults implements ResultSetProvider
050{
051    /**
052     * Return the names, types, and values of parameters supplied as a single
053     * anonymous RECORD type; the parameter is given an empty-record default,
054     * allowing it to be omitted in calls, or used with the named-parameter
055     * call syntax.
056     *<p>
057     * For example, this function could be called as:
058     *<pre>
059     * SELECT (paramDefaultsRecord()).*;
060     *</pre>
061     * or as:
062     *<pre>
063     * SELECT (paramDefaultsRecord(params =&gt; s)).*
064     * FROM (SELECT 42 AS a, '42' AS b, 42.0 AS c) AS s;
065     *</pre>
066     */
067    @Function(
068        requires = "paramtypeinfo type",
069        schema = "javatest",
070        implementor = "postgresql_ge_80400", // supports function param DEFAULTs
071        type = "javatest.paramtypeinfo"
072        )
073    public static ResultSetProvider paramDefaultsRecord(
074        @SQLType(defaultValue={})ResultSet params)
075    throws SQLException
076    {
077        return new RecordParameterDefaults(params);
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Like paramDefaultsRecord but illustrating the use of a named row type
082     * with known structure, and supplying a default for the function
083     * parameter.
084     *<p>
085     *<pre>
086     * SELECT paramDefaultsNamedRow();
087     *
088     * SELECT paramDefaultsNamedRow(userWithNum =&gt; ('fred', 3.14));
089     *</pre>
090     */
091    @Function(
092        requires = "foobar tables", // created in Triggers.java
093        implementor = "postgresql_ge_80400", // supports function param DEFAULTs
094        schema = "javatest"
095        )
096    public static String paramDefaultsNamedRow(
097        @SQLType(value="javatest.foobar_2", defaultValue={"bob", "42"})
098        ResultSet userWithNum)
099    throws SQLException
100    {
101        return String.format("username is %s and value is %s",
102            userWithNum.getObject("username"), userWithNum.getObject("value"));
103    }
104
105
106
107    private final ResultSetMetaData m_paramrsmd;
108    private final Object[] m_values;
109    
110    RecordParameterDefaults(ResultSet paramrs) throws SQLException
111    {
112        m_paramrsmd = paramrs.getMetaData();
113        /*
114         * Grab the values from the parameter SingleRowResultSet now; it isn't
115         * guaranteed to stay valid for the life of the set-returning function.
116         */
117        m_values = new Object [ m_paramrsmd.getColumnCount() ];
118        for ( int i = 0; i < m_values.length; ++ i )
119            m_values[i] = paramrs.getObject( 1 + i);
120    }
121
122    @Override
123    public boolean assignRowValues(ResultSet receiver, int currentRow)
124    throws SQLException
125    {
126        int col = 1 + currentRow;
127        if ( col > m_paramrsmd.getColumnCount() )
128            return false;
129        receiver.updateString("name", m_paramrsmd.getColumnLabel(col));
130        receiver.updateString("pgtypename", m_paramrsmd.getColumnTypeName(col));
131        Object o = m_values[col - 1];
132        receiver.updateString("javaclass", o.getClass().getName());
133        receiver.updateString("tostring", o.toString());
134        return true;
135    }
136
137    @Override
138    public void close() throws SQLException
139    {
140        fill(m_values, null);
141    }
142}
